NomaiObject:
<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
CONOY: Friends, I write urgently on behalf of the <color=orange>Quantum Weather Lab:</color> Are there any safeguards against the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> during the operation of the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project?</color>
2
1
YARROW: No, but.. Why would we need safeguards against the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon,</color> Conoy?
3
2
CONOY: That is worrying.. The <color=orange>Quantum Weather Lab</color> has found that the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> can cause unpredictable discrepancies in the negative time interval due to its gravitational pull.
4
2
CONOY: If the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> randomly begins orbiting <color=lightblue>Giant's Deep,</color> we fear it may influence the trajectories of probes launched from the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon.</color>
5
4
CONOY: These compromised trajectories would be recorded in the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> as unremarkable and redundant to repeat.. As a result, any number of trajectories that could find the Eye may be overlooked!
6
5
YARROW: How profoundly horrifying! I had not considered the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> to be such a threat to the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project..</color> My deepest gratitude for reporting this concern, Conoy.
7
6
YARROW: An update: we have added a safeguard to detect when the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> is orbiting <color=lightblue>Giant's Deep.</color>
8
7
YARROW: Though it still requires Nomai to observe the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon,</color> we hope that this safeguard will protect the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> from the potential interference you described!
Workshop R3 8
